reviews.text: Love this place. Took my 13yr old dog here for her last day.........god I miss her

Great loop around the lake for a fun family hike. We did it with another family - 6 boys 6 and under. They seemed exhausted until we got back to the playground...amazing how fast the energy came back!
Always love being here, a perfect spot to be with the family! A nice loop for running or walking and plenty of open space to let kids run or have a BBQ. It's great!
Nice place to have a family outing pretty clean lake
Pretty good sized park and the lake for family and friends events

Had an amazingly beautiful and moving experience on Martin Luther King Day. The performance(s) were asking for food donations to the local food Bank which was very thoughtful.

It was a wonderful experience for myself and my children. Trying to reconnect with a small town on a multi-cultural bonding that we (family & I) have been missing since leaving L.A. Very poignant brave women, men and children keeping important memories, struggles and history to life during these chaotic times. Through dance, music, singing, and poetry it was a lively mix of love, life, loss, and the importance of humanity. 

My small children were quiet and in awe of the performances. I truly felt touched in my soul and shed a few tears of overwhelming care, thought and compassion. I will be attending every year moving forward. I would love to be involved more! We must never forget what we (our nation) was built on and endured and continues battling with. Sharing true honest history is knowledge and empowerment. We need to move forward and progress this world for our children as every single being unites for the greater good of humanity.

Watched a play, packed. Beautiful theater. Microphone issues. Play not very interactive. Kids scratching head and bored. Adults too. Sorry🤔 ivan the gorilla.
Bathrooms so nice and clean. Parking pretty poor.
Beautiful, historic venue, and a fun place for concerts and shows. Reasonable prices for tickets. Restrooms are too small unfortunately, so lines are common. Foyer gets crowded before doors open.

This is a Grand old theater with the typical ornate ceilings and walls of its Era. Even the handrails and such going up to the balcony are well worth looking at closely. Sound and lighting were very good and not too intrusive to the original design and decor. Comfortable seats with good placement and legroom. Super helpful ushers who went to great lengths to make me able to get around with ease. Highly recommend it.

I have enjoyed MBT for various shows but today I am waiting to watch the nutcracker and I purchased a hot chocolate for my wife and they asked if I wanted to spend an additional 3 dollars for a glass that I could take into the theater.   I said sure.   After spending the 5 dollars for a glass of hot chocolate they gave me a glass that was half full.  I asked them to fill it up the rest of the way and they said no.  In fact they said they filled it up to much to begin with.  They told me that you purchase the hot chocolate by the oz and not the glass.    Which I would have no issue with if that is what they advertised

The carpet was MAGNIFICENT!   ...In all honesty, my wife and I were a little apprehensive that we would be two of very few in the audience, since there showed so many seats available for the show online. That was NOT the case, for the were many, many walk-ins!  The show was AWESOME,  so much that we considered buying the later showing that night.  We will DEFINITELY COME BACK..!  LOVED IT!

This place is SO much fun! Shout outs from the audience requested! Every show is different. Love that they have alcohol and snacks available. Has a very club vibe, low lighting, small tables, hip. You could get lucky and catch a show with Ryan Styles (and I've heard on rare occasions Drew Carey) in a show. Get there early because they often sell out!

This cute local venue had really fun and talented performers. It's perfect for dates, nights out with friends, or even a night alone. The drinks are a bit over priced, but tickets are worth every penny.
100% agree that this is the best place in Bellingham for date night. It's just as awesome solo or with friends. You'll laugh till you hurt.
I absolutely love the Gateway Show. I've been to it twice now and I couldn't stop laughing the entire time.

The trails and views were beautiful. It was an easy hike. There were some stairs but you didn't have to go up them to see the falls. This one is a good one for the family. Lots of ducks hand out in the ponds. Definitely a great place to stop if you are in the area.

Beautiful park with tons of trails. Dog friendly too, which I love. I still need to revisit the falls but it's a great place to walk, run, hike, etc. There are also multiple places you can stop and rest which I appreciate

Absolutely beautiful! First time in Washington today and a friend brought us here. A little muddy because it rained last night but overall gorgeous scenery, fresh air, and nice trails. We would love to come again.
I wish this park was closer to where I live. It's got several trails that are almost completely flat. And 2+ waterfalls. With the best waterfall being right next to the parking lot (so easy access).
This is a popular park. Right now it's still fairly private but it's busy in the summer! Teo playgrounds, hot food and coffee nearby on Electric Avenue. It's s good place to go walking.
Cuuuute cafe with a straightforward menu at amazing prices. Very accommodating with a great staff. The coffee was amazing and the food better!
Hands Down the best breakfast in town. fresh ingredients, well prepared. expect a wait for a seat on the weekends.

"Would not recommend!", I stop in a few times, at first I was pleased and impressed with both service and the quality of what I ordered.

But it only took two bad experiences. - The last two visits , my to-go order was less than appetizing,  the sandwich was barely eatible and the chips were remnants of the bottom of the bag.

Maybe it was my timing, going there the last 45 minutes they are open (?) But, that should not matter, the first 45 or the last 45, service should be comparable. 

I will not go back!
Wonderful food great service reasonable prices
Amazing breakfast. Can't wait to try more menu items. Will definitely come back.

Here are the three things I was disappointed in. 1.) Ordered the Mama Rudy and it was bland, cardboard-ish crust and cheese was barely melted, not close to bubbly and the toppings were a bit raw (not in a good way.) 2.) The women's restroom was disgusting. The toilet looked like it hadn't been cleaned in months. Like we're talking stuff growing in the bowl (isn't there a state health regulation on restroom cleanliness...especially in an eating establishment?) The floor was equally dirty. Then the toilet paper dispenser was positioned in a way that made it very difficult to retrieve, which was an issue after trying to create a major toilet paper barrier on the toilet seat to deem it useable. If I wasn't in dire need to utilize it, I would have gladly walked several blocks to use a decent restroom. 3.) I decided to give their large chocolate chip cookie a try in hopes of redeeming the previous two issues. It was OK, just plain dough and chocolate chips...very plain. The real issue, however, was that there was a piece of eggshell in the cookie. Luckily I noticed the little white thing in the otherwise smooth featureless top of the cookie. I was able to dig it out before my tooth crunched it...whew, I would have gagged. Luckily I was in good company during my visit, making my time there otherwise enjoyable. I wasn't feeling up to confronting the staff about any of these issues as I should have. It was my husband's birthday so I didn't want any potential unpleasantness so I kept it all to myself. I understand that this establishment's price point is low for Bellingham, but I would still expect edible food and a bathroom cleaned at least once a week. I dislike giving a locally owned (I'm assuming) business a unsatisfactory review, but they really need to make some improvements.

Great pizza place! They have beer on tap and the interior is really cute. Pizza is huge and not super pricey. My favorite is their vegetarian Mama Rudy which has ample fresh vegetables and goes really well with the cheese they use.

Would definitely recommend!
Best pizza I've ever had no contest. Used to go here three years ago then went again and the food is as good as ever.

Definitely my favorite place to get pizza in town. I love that there is a whole wheat option, and they always have different specials. The only thing I would say is that if the person taking your order doesn’t remember to ask you what kind of crust you want (whole wheat or regular, thin or thick) then you automatically end up with thin white crust, and I’m just not a thin crust kinda gal. I don’t like feeling like I have to slap two pieces of pizza together to gain a little weight. So definitely remember to tell them what kind of crust you want if you’re as picky as me and they don’t ask. Other than that, no complaints. Love this place, just writing this review makes me want to go pick a pie up.
Pizza was very good though although very greasy. I will definitely go back for more!

Finally visited this restaurant! Our other locale changed their special so we stopped in here. A very swanky joint, with a huge menu. Order at the counter, take your number and find a seat. An awesome salsa bar to hit up while you wait, which won't be long ;) portions are nice and prices are decent.

Solid Mexican food done in a mostly American style but still holding onto some traditional methods. Portions are great,  and the food always comes up quickly and correctly.  The salsa bar is good with several options, and they have margaritas!

I love the food here. Their rice is great and so is the salsa. Sometimes I'm full from eating to much salsa before our food comes. I really enjoy their chicken flautas. Service is usually fast though it fills up on a weekend. The fact that they give you delicious chips and salsa to snack on before you get your food makes me love the place even more!
Very good molé on Fridays!! Lovely place, very warm, welcome and comforting.  Good is delicious.  One of favorite restaurants in town.

Best in town... Meaning that in downtown, among the basically terrible options, Lobo is not terrible. It's about as good as procedural recipes, bulk truck ingredients, and asleep at the wheel Mexican food can get. Don't get me wrong, the truck dropped off ingredients recently, and the procedure being followed is spot on for what most folks want. This is good news, Lobo is rising above the low low floor for what most North Americans expect out of Mexican food.

The food is always stellar, the beer is aplenty. Something for everyone here from gourmet mac n cheese to lamb burgers and gumbo. Can be a fun sports bar atmosphere if there's a good game going on, or a family friendly dining experience any time. The outdoor beer garden is popular in the warmer months. I always enjoy perusing the local rotating art that's on display. You can also grab a six pack to go!

Great place for a night out with friends or family. This place has a lot of award winning beers and some really good food. They are very involved with community events many starting there or ending there with parties afterward. During the summer they have a nice outdoor area that they put to good use with bands and family movie nights. Even though they have good food they host events with a variety of food trucks. Located across the street from the farmers market I love to hit the market then stop in for lunch.

Absolutely delicious, haven't finished off a plate like that in so long! Quentin was a delight, very upbeat and attentive, handled my allergies beautifully, he came back to clarify edits to the dish with the best mindset of how to make the best dish for me instead of just how to switch out what had to be subbed, with particular consideration to the best taste. Phenomenal service. It was a great repeat experience for my fiance and I, and a great first one for my sister and her family. My BIL really liked the in house beer, and the kids loved the Mac and cheese!

I rarely give out 5 star's but I've been going here since they opened over a decade ago.I must say that it's always consistently great food and beer. I've never had a bad experience besides maybe waiting longer than I would like to get a table but hey that's what you get when a place is good.

Went during a Saturday dinner rush wait was shorter than expected. Our server was very friendly, and knowledgeable of the menu. Prices are very reasonable. Mac n cheese was the best I've had in a while.  Beef burger and potatoes were decent. Restaurant itself Needs a little work inside. Had to shove a napkin under the table leg to fix a horrendous wabble. Most of the fixtures and furniture is old, worn and leaves a little to be desired with the dining atmosphere. I know some people like that but just my opinion.  Had been to the beer garden during the summer which was great. Live music outdoor taps, great drinks.

This place always has outstanding food and exceptional service. Used to live in Bellingham and came here all the time. Now I live about an hour away, but make the trip whenever I have the chance because it’s that good.

Cozy Mexican restaurant. Food is very good with tons of options. Best Mexican restaurant I've been to in Bellingham and enjoyed it even though my family is usually not Mexican food lovers. Worth the visit with great staff 👍. Very fun and out going. If you want to try something new and different this is definitely the place.
The waiter was quirky and cute with an odd sense humor. Oh and the food was good too
The food is good depending on what you get. Seafood is all likely frozen so I would not get any of that. Good margaritas.
Great Mexican big portions and good service, I recommend rating here for sure.

One of my local favorites! This is not a quick bite sort of place to eat. That being said, it is the kind of place where you can go anytime and get the same quality service. It's the place that you go to sober up when the bars close and also the place to get breakfast during the week/end. The food is always good, and it's the little things that make it great, like the freezer jam, homemade biscuits, real butter for your pancakes, and where you can still get chicken and waffles combos. My favorite go-to is the mushroom and pesto omelette but everything on the breakfast menu is good. My daughter loves the biscuits and old fashioned sausage gravy they make fresh every day.
Used to go there every Saturday with my parents when I was growing up, great food and great hospitality.  The reputation has not changed one bit.  I highly recommend this establishment.
Thank you to my server Camille for helping me she good hostess. A big thank you to Rodney the cook I had the blue cheese burger best I ever had! Best burgers in town by far.

They've got one of the best breakfast sandwiches I've ever had and their fries are just the way I like them: skinny, crispy, and taste like potato. Nice, cozy atmosphere and not too expensive (I'm used to DFW cost of living and these prices felt normal to me). Worth stopping in.

My personal favorite breakfast place in Bellingham. I love that so many of the menu items are sourced locally. The staff is always friendly and on top of things with the service.  I've had several meals off the breakfast menu and you can't go wrong with any of them.

Very nice restaurant with good food and kind staff. We enjoyed lunch on a slow post-Christmas day. My wife and son had soup, and I had a turkey-bacon club that was very good. Reasonably priced and, if it's your thing, they have wine and cans of beer. Good, warm, cozy atmosphere. Definitely recommend.

This is a cool little spot. It's busy, but for good reason. I had Eggs Benny which were amazing 😋 service was good and the full meals typically ran in the $15-20 range. A bit pricey for breakfast, but the food really was super good. I would definitely come again.
This is one of my favorite restaurants in town. They have the best eggs Benedict and fresh baked goods. Highly recommend.
Great Eggs Benedict, even vegan sausage! Savory and sweet crepes available. Yummy croissants of all different types. Great breakfast place in Bellingham.

A charming spot to hoover up your favorite carb-delivery package.  I prefer crapes, but others might venture into waffles or pancakes.  That's fine for you - it's a free country.  And Mt. Bakery has plenty of savory and sweet options for you to graze through on your way to post-brunch naptown, population: zzzzzzzzzzzzzzzz

Skylark's is a Great place to eat. The staff is exceptionally well attentive, friendly, and knowledgeable of the menu. The salad is fresh and portions are quite filling. The Bread Pudding is Absolutely Amazing. And atmosphere is is for all.

We went to Skylarks for the first time a few weeks ago for breakfast. Everything we had was really fresh and tasty. The toasted banana bread was the best I've ever had! The restaurant is charming and in a great location. The service was fair because our waitress was not very friendly and inattentive but the food was so good, we are looking forward to going back to try lunch and dinner.

Had a great breakfast here today. Our server, Angela could not have been more accommodating and helpful. Got me the dish I wanted with a few tweaks and made me feel that she really cared that I got exactly what I was hoping for. Will definately be back and I highly suggest you give this place a try.

THEY DON'T HAVE APPETIZERS; Unless it's dinner time is what I'm told. Had one of their hot buttered rums instead. It was awful. We left quickly. Service was not very fast or friendly. Was better in the past. Will not return.
Good food and service, mostly. I did see a waiter speak very rudely to an elderly couple when I arrived. That was pretty disappointing.
